result.execSummary:
The defendant Boguslaw (nmi) Komarowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Boguslaw (nmi) Komarowski

records.addlTxt: notice of intent to certify debt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: convert all financial obligations unpaid to civil judgment
restitution convert to civil judgment
Cover Letter from agent

Defendant Boguslaw (nmi) Komarowski in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter via video J. Garber. Court sworn in interpreter.  Court calls case and introduces the parties in court.  Agent Nicole Belk appears by phone.  Last information court recv'd DE paid little of restitution.  Defendant is due to discharge from supervision on January 8, 2017 and as of 10/1/16 the following obligations have not been paid:  Restitution $4,811.26.  State received letter from agent that DE has paid substantial amount in the last month.  Court just recv'd letter 12/20/16.  Court reviewing the letter now.  $1314.33 in last year has been paid.   Agent believes DE has made good faith effort and should be discharged.  State's position at this time is agent explain why $685 paid first 9 mos. and over $600 in the last 2 mos.  Agent Belk explains no substantial change in income, has paid approximatley $100/mo. State states given the explanation no objection to allow discharge and the remaining balances be civil judgment.  Court asks DE if wanting to stay on probation.  DE does not.  Court is satisfied and is not ordering probation be extended at this time.  Upon discharge agent submit order for civil judgment of unpaid financial obligations.
Cover Letter from atty. Calkins
Probation review hearing on December 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Boguslaw (nmi) Komarowski in court with attorney Eric J Pollex w/ interpreter Joanna G.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amend to misd. theft. Class A.  State gives recommendation.  Plea to Count 1.  Attorney Pollex agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  State gives final statement.  Defendant makes statement.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
12 months Probation
$5497.00 Restitution with 10% Surcharge
$243.00 costs and $10.00 property crime surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-08-2016 03:00 pm
Exhibits 1-3
Telephone scheduling conference at 12-23-2015 08:15 am

State calls P.F., general manager of Pierce's Supermarket.  Sworn & testifies.  Marked exh. 1 & 2.  Cited exh 1 by P.F.  Testifies as to defendant's employment hours and duties for being in the store.  Testifies as to the responsibilities to the store by the defendant.  Attorney Pollex cross examines.  Cites exh. 2.  Marked exh 3.  Cited and identified by P.F.  Attorney Pollex offer exhibits 1-3.  State agrees.  Court received exh. 1-3.  State redirect.  Attorney Pollex recross.  Court questions P.F. on Exh. 1.  State asks follow up questions based on court's questions.  Attorney Pollex asks follow up questions based on court and State's follow up.  State calls T.D., Super Clean Inc. by phone, sworn in by the court.  State goes through defendant employment responsibilities.  T.D. reimbursed Pierce's.  Attorney Pollex cross examines T.D.  Attorney Pollex calls defendant B.K. to the stand, S&T.  Atty. Calkins cross examines B.K.  Brief argument.  State makes argument, strong circumstantial evidence.  Atty. Pollex makes argument, not met burden of proof, victim made whole.  Court sites 973, burden demonstrating is on the victim, satisfied victim has demonstrated in a lose from a crime, defendant has already paid up that lose and grants restitution, Court sites a couple appeals cases. Determine an appropriate amount and be ordered at plea/sentencing.

Defendant Boguslaw (nmi) Komarowski in court with attorney Eric J. Pollex and Interpreter, Joanna Garber.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to 943.20(1)(a).  misd theft.  Joint recommendation given by the State.  Restitution hearing to take place prior to plea.   State request testimony by phone for restitution hearing.  Attorney Pollex does not object to telephone testimony.  State clarifies testimony to be given.  Attorney Pollex notes two standard objections.  Amount and victim was the store, which was already conpensated.   State explains T.D. the victim vs. the store at this point.  Notes judicial review of 973.20.  Attorney Pollex argues T.D. is not the victim.  CV court vs. criminal court for restitution purposes.  Proceed to restitution hearing.

Restitution hearing at 12-16-2015 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-16-2015 10:30 am.
Status conference at 10-14-2015 08:45 am

Defendant Boguslaw (nmi) Komarowski in court with attorney Eric J. Pollex and interpreter Joanna G.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Pollex states status.  DE has agreed to enter a plea at a later date and then a restitution hearing would also be held at that time for interpreter purposes.  State is in agreement.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Final pre-trial at 10-12-2015 01:00 pm
Jury trial at 10-20-2015 08:30 am
Atty Pollex acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charge/max penalty and enters NG plea.  Bond continued pending JT.

Defendant Boguslaw (nmi) Komarowski in court with attorney Eric J. Pollex and interpreter Joanna G.  Sue Mueller and intern Rick S appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Pollex says the matter is not resolved and requests JT.  Court notes prelim hasn't been held yet.  Atty Pollex notes time limits previously waived and he will waive prelim today.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver.  DE wishes more time to discuss waiver w/his attorney.  Short recess.  Back on the record, the DE now wishes to waive his right to prelim.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.

Pre-trial conference at 07-10-2015 11:30 am.
Return date at 07-21-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Boguslaw (nmi) Komarowski in court with attorney Eric J. Pollex and interpreter J.G.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of complaint.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 11:30 am.  Return date scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 06-17-2015 01:00 pm.
